properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 19 at 1:27PM PST until January 21 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4000 feet. Total snow
accumulations of 6 to 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as
high as 50 mph in exposed high terrain areas.

* WHERE...Western Siskiyou County areas above 4000 feet to
include Etna Summit on Sawyers Bar Road.

* WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty
winds could bring down tree branches.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could exceed one inch per
hour Tuesday morning.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries,
blankets, food, water, and medications.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm.

* A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant
snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET
